title: Why are chloroplasts called the kitchen of a plant cell?

json.text: Plant Cell: Why are chloroplasts called the kitchen of a plant cell?
Chloroplasts are special structures present only in plant cells.
They contain a green pigment called chlorophyll.
With the help of this chlorophyll, the plants prepare their food in the presence of water, sunlight and oxygen.
Hence, chloroplasts are called the kitchen of a plant cell.
